Topic: " Finding the Good Life"This course draws from contemporary cinema, television, and social media to contemplate exactly what is the "good life" and, equally important, how to go about finding it. Diverse filmmakers, screenwriters, and animators explore themes of virtue, success, and personal transformation, many drawing explicitly on religious and philosophical schools around the world that have offered various answers to such questions. Drawing from a range of films and media representations around the world, this course explores what it means to be human, what the good life might look like, and how one might pursue it.
course_description: Narrative films concerned with religious issues and experience; commonalities between the film medium and the performative religious imagination.
